Haskell, Spacemacs & Intero

February 4, 2017

Oh and Stack. This is a quick guide on setting up a simple Haskell development environment.

Stack

First download and install Stack. Make sure to keep the default recommendations during the install. Then go to your home directory and type in your terminal

> stack new myproj
> cd myproj

Stack's LTS resolver usually lags a bit behind ghc development, currently at 8.0.2 vs Stack LTS's 8.0.1. So to get 8.0.2 you simply open stack.yaml in your project directory and edit Selected resolver to be "nightly-2017-02-03" or whatever the current snapshot. Then type the following in your terminal while still inside the project directory

> stack setup
> git init

It might take a couple of minutes or so depending on your internet connection.

Spacemacs

Now to the chosen editor, Spacemacs. It's essentially Emacs evil mode with nice defaults and is very customisable. Follow the instructions to install Emacs and Spacemacs here for your current OS. Don't worry if it looks ugly for now üòú.

Intero

Intero is a package for Emacs that provides awesome stuff like jump to definition, type identifier, etcetera. To install simply open your .spacemacs file in your home directory and append

(haskell :variables haskell-completion-backend 'intero)

to dotspacemacs-configuration-layers. Then reload with SPC f e R while still in Spacemacs. Next open your previously built stack project and open app/Main.hs

Annnd done! üéâ
